"9886a8c6-10a5-4037-b8b0-787ce1bc41c1", "data": {"protoText": "The frog is then placed on top of crushed ice covered with wet tissue paper, to avoid the skin from drying out. A small incision is made in the upper skin of about 1 cm length, and a 0.5 cm cut in the inner skin and the muscular layer"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 2}, {"position": {"x": 499, "y": -25}, "size": {"width": 340, "height": 208}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "b7c89a0d-274c-4ea1-b3ee-40144e0aac23", "data": {"protoText": "Using forceps, small clumps of oocytes (depending on the amount required, usually 500\u20131500 oocytes) are removed and are treated twice for 90 minutes in collagenase A (or D), having low trypsin activity in a calcium free ORII solution, in order to remove follicular layers. Typically, 10 ml of collagenase solution is placed in a sterile 15 ml tube, and after cutting the ovarian lobes into small clusters of oocytes, up to 3 ml of oocytes are added per tube."}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 3}, {"position": {"x": 915, "y": 11}, "size": {"width": 220, "height": 136}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "b81f677b-f458-49b4-98c2-925292db8ebd", "data": {"protoText": "The tube is rotated in the dark at 18\u00b0C on an orbital rotor spinning at low speed (20 rpm) for 90 min. and then replaced by a new collagenase-ORII solution for another 90 min"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 4}, {"position": {"x": 1203, "y": 20}, "size": {"width": 175, "height": 118}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": with modified Barth\u2019s solution"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 5}, {"position": {"x": 1437, "y": 11}, "size": {"width": 205, "height": 136}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "f888434c-91ae-4acc-963c-a4360c643d90", "data": {"protoText": "The oocytes are sorted for morphologically intact, healthy looking stage V\u2013VI oocytes. The oocytes are subsequently maintained in MBS at 18 \u00b0C (kept in the dark)."}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 6}, {"position": {"x": 1715, "y": -7}, "size": {"width": 280, "height": 172}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "2a5ce5b2-29e6-4b1f-9e63-6f5770de680f", "data": {"protoText": "Usually on the next day, healthy looking stage V\u2013VI oocytes are injected with either 50 nl water (control) or mRNA (at concentrations varying from 0 to 1 \u00b5g/\u00b5l), using a semiautomatic injector. Oocytes are then kept at 18\u00b0C in MBS for 1 to 7 days, with changes of MBS solution every 1\u20132 days"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 7}, {"position": {"x": 1625, "y": 320}, "size": {"width": 370, "height": 226}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "3398d253-c474-4234-a91c-2e23d04c42bd", "data": {"protoText": "Oocytes (7\u201310 oocytes per individual data point) are first washed for 1\u20132 minutes in solution A. This solution is then replaced by 100 \u00b5l of solution A supplemented with the desired concentration of substrate (eg. 1 mM K2SO4), at the desired specific activity for the isotope. The specific activities for the different substrates used (eg. 32PO42-, 35SO42-) are usually between 10\u201340 \u00b5Ci/ml. Uptakes are routinely performed in the presence of sodium (100 mM NaCl) or in its absence (100 mM choline chloride) and incubated in a water bath at 25\u00b0C for various times (1\u201360 min.)."}, Isotopic uptake (transport assay) is measured by liquid scintillation spectrometry (normally counted for 2 min/vial)."}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 11}, {"position": {"x": 395, "y": 320}, "size": {"width": 355, "height": 226}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "4b46f2cc-8f5d-4565-ae0e-c1f34560e098", "data": {"protoText": "Using a functionally positive unfractionated or size-fractionated mRNA as starting material, a directional cDNA library is constructed using a commercial kit, following the manufacturers protocol (in our case the SuperScript plasmid system, pSPORT-1 vector, Gibco/BRL; SuperScript reverse transcriptase having no RNase H activity). The total library, usually in the range of 105\u2013106 clones, is subdivided into pools of 1,000 colonies, which are plated onto 9 cm Luria Broth plates (containing ampicillin 100 \u00b5g/ml)"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 12}, {"position": {"x": 81, "y": 356}, "size": {"width": 250, "height": 154}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": "b686ee94-f14b-4590-8535-06085eecb1f8", "data": {"protoText": "When the colonies are visible, two replicas are made onto nitrocellulose or nylon filters with both replica filters being placed on top of LB plates (colonies side up) for about 6 hours until colonies are visible (1 mm diameter)."}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 13}, {"position": {"x": 73.5, "y": 740}, "size": {"width": 265, "height": 172}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "077c40cd-402e-4783-8d68-3b20d172eac1", "data": {"protoText": "One filter is placed on top of an agar/glycerol plate, with the colonies side up and kept as a master plate at \u201380\u00b0C (sealed with parafilm). The second replica is submerged into 10ml Luria Broth containing ampicillin (100 \u00b5g/ml) and grown overnight at 37\u00b0C with shaking (300 rpm)."}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 14}, {"position": {"x": 404, "y": 695}, "size": {"width": 415, "height": 262}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "3cd7c2fe-1ce8-43e3-99f3-8264c426891a", "data": {"protoText": "The cells are pelleted by centrifugation for 1 min and plasmids are isolated using a general plasmid (alkaline lysis) method. About 1\u20132 \u00b5g of plasmid are digested with an appropriate restriction enzyme cutting at the 3\u00b4 end of the insert (in our case NotI). An aliquot is run through an agarose gel to check if the digestion was complete and the rest is extracted twice with a mixture of 0.1 M Tris pH 8 saturated phenol: chloroform: isoamylalcohol (25:24:1) and then precipitated with 0.1 volume 3 M sodium acetate and 2.5 volume cold 100% ethanol at \u201320\u00baC for 2 hours. Plasmids are then dissolved in 10 \u00b5l of water and used for in vitro transcription, using the appropriate RNA polymerase (in our case T7)"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 15}, {"position": {"x": 897, "y": 758}, "size": {"width": 220, "height": 136}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": "custom-react-shape", "ports": {"groups": {"top": {"position": "top", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "right": {"position": "right", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "bottom": {"position": "bottom", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}, "left": {"position": "left", "attrs": {"circle": {"r": 4, "magnet": true, "stroke": "#5F95FF", "strokeWidth": 1, "fill": "#fff", "style": {"visibility": "hidden"}}}}}, "items": [{"group": "top", "id": "84f47830-8f52-4e2b-b3ba-94fce46d5583"}, {"group": "right", "id": "24fcf524-deeb-443e-857b-dd0e98488157"}, {"group": "bottom", "id": "dadea173-f56e-4b41-bebe-bb9bbcf6102b"}, {"group": "left", "id": "3d59c228-b134-4643-8aeb-31d58637d5d8"}]}, "id": "dce0834c-fd9d-4436-97ec-acb3aa3349ab", "data": {"protoText": "For in vitro transcription, the whole 10 \u00b5l (approx. 1 \u00b5g) of linearized plasmid DNA is used and is added to 40 \u00b5l of the transcription mixture. The reaction is incubated at 37\u00b0C for 1 hour"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 16}, {"position": {"x": 1188, "y": 758}, "size": {"width": 205, "height": 136}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape": 70% ethanol and vacuum dried for 5 min"}, "type": "textNode", "zIndex": 19}, {"position": {"x": 1203, "y": 1111}, "size": {"width": 265, "height": 154}, "view": "react-shape-view", "shape":
